menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Encrypted|1:Encrypted
41:Sensor Rest|42:Sensor Motion|11:Ignition Off Rest|12:Ignition On Motion|21:Ignition On Rest|22:Ignition On Motion|1A:Fake Tow|16:Tow|
0:Stop Charging|1:Charging
0:Unknow|1:Inserted|2:Removed|3:Ready|4:Locked Pin|5:Locked PUK|
0: No Searching|1: Registered|2: Searching|3: Denied|4: Unknown|5: Roaming|
0: No Searching|1: Registered|2: Searching|3: Denied|4: Unknown|5: Roaming|6: Only Local SMS|7: Only Roaming SMS|8: Registration of Emergency Services|
0: Deactivated|1: Activating|2: Activated|3: Deactivating|
0: Initial|1: No Service|2: Idle|3: Activating|4: Connecting|5: Sending|6: Reset|
0: Closed|1: Opened|
0: Connected|1: Disconnected|3: Unknown|
0: GPGSV|1: GLGSV|2: BDGSV|3:GAGSV|
Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input 6|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
Digital output 1|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
0: Read|1: Send|
0: Normal IO|1: Function IO|2: Interrupt IO|
0: Input|1: Output|
0: Low level|1: High Level|
0: Disable Pull|1: Enable Pull|
0: Pull Down|1: Pull Up|
0: Disable BLE Chip|1: Enable BLE Chip|
0: BG22C224|1: BLUENRG345|

menu2.name: BSI (Bearer Settings Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBSI is used to configure the parameters for GSM/GPRS/LTE data connection.

menu3.Description: Access point name.
The user name of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
Backup access point name.
The user name of backup APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of backup APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Auto (LTE & GSM)|1: GSM Only|3: LTE Only|

menu2.name: SRI (Server Registration Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSRI is used to configure how to report all the messages, including the server information and the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal. If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|8:HTTP mode|9:MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority|2: High priority |
menu3.Description: If the buffer report function is enabled and the device goes into areas without network coverage, it will store all reports locally. If the device goes into areas with network coverage again, it will then send all the buffered reports.
The IP address or the domain name of the main server.
The port number of the main server.
The IP address or the domain name of the backup server.
The port number of the backup server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK message when receiving a message from the terminal.
This parameter defines the format of the report messages sent from the device to the backend server.
This parameter defines whether to reply with the ACK confirmation via SMS when the command is sent via SMS.

A numeral to indicate the time to maintain TCP connection for receiving commands from the server. If there is no data transmission within the time of <Connection Life>, the TCP connection will be closed. The unit is second.
The address of primary DNS server.
The address of secondary DNS server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:not reply|1:reply
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server will respond to the terminal with specified SACK messages when receiving the specified messages (i.e. +RESP:GTCID) from the terminal. It is valid when the parameter <SACK Enable> is disabled.

menu2.name: QSS (Quick Start Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTQSS is used to configure GPRS and backend server parameters if the length of all the settings is less than 160 bytes. Otherwise, the two commands AT+GTBSI and AT+GTSRI are used to set those parameters.

menu3.Description: Access Point Name
The user name of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|8:HTTP mode|9:MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority |2: High priority|
menu3.Description: If the buffer report function is enabled and the device goes into areas without network coverage, it will store all reports locally. If the device goes into areas with network coverage again, it will then send all the buffered reports.
The IP address or the domain name of the main backend server.
The port of the main backend server.
The IP address or the domain name of the backup backend server.
The port of the backup backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK message when receiving a message from the terminal.
This parameter defines the format of the report messages sent from the device to the backend server.
This parameter defines whether to reply with the ACK confirmation via SMS when the command is sent via SMS.
The address of primary DNS server.
The address of secondary DNS server.

menu2.name: MQT ( MQTT Server Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMQT is used to configure the username and password to connect to the MQTT server and to subscribe to topics and publish topics, If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the MQTT server.

menu3.Description: It is used to set keep alive mechanism for MQTT. It is a time interval measured in minutes. In particular, 0 means the keep alive mechanism is disabled.
If the MQTT server uses authentication, the username is specified here.
If the MQTT server uses authentication, the password is specified here.
The client subscribes to topic name.
The client publishes topic name.

Each client connected to the server has a unique client identifier (Client ID). Both the client and the server must use the Client ID to identify the state associated with the MQTT session between them. The Client ID can contain only uppercase letters, lowercase letters and numeric characters.

menu2.name: TLS (TLS Data Encryption)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTLS is used to configure TLS encryption parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The Data Server of SRI|
menu3.Description: The index of the Server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Do not verify the certificates|1: Only server certification|2: Two-way certification between server and client
menu3.Description: It specifies the certificate verification method for the terminal.

menu2.name: CFG (Global Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCFG command is used to configure global parameters.

menu3.Description: It is set to change the current password.
An ASCII string which represents the name of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable the odograph by GNSS|
menu3.Description: Enable/Disable the odograph function to calculate the total mileage.
The initial value for calculating the total mileage.

menu3.RangeMx: Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Mileage|Send Time|Device Name|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of report messages, especially the composition of GNSS information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: GNSS Deep Saving Mode|2: GNSS Low Saving Mode|
menu3.Description: Enable or disable power saving mode, which is used to save power consumption of an external power or internal device battery.

menu3.RangeMx: The number of satellites in view for the current position (GNSS satellite number)|Reserved for indicating <GNSS Trigger Type> (in +RESP:GTFRI and +RESP:GTERI) report which can’t be set here|
menu3.Description: A bitwise numeral to control whether to include the corresponding fields in each position after <Cell ID>.
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent to the backend server.
It configures the working mode of PIN on the connector.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Each time the device powers on, all LEDs will work for 30 minutes and then be off|1: All LEDs will be turned on as configured|2: All LEDs will work 10 minutes after the device is powered on and then will be off|
menu3.Description: It configures the working mode of the LED lights.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the device information report (+RESP:GTINF).
The interval for reporting the device information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Ignore SMS location request.|1: Report the current location(+RESP:GTLBC) to server.|2: Send current location with Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|&0: Hang up only.|1: Hang up and report the current location (+RESP:GTLBC) to server.|2: Hang up the call and send current location with Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|3: Both 1 And 2|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask for SMS. 4 high bits for SMS request. Each bit represents one kind of report. Set it to 1 to enable the corresponding report, and set it to 0 to disable.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable backup battery. The backup battery will only be used when this parameter is set to 1 and the external power is not connected.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Charge On Need|1: Charge After Ignition On|
menu3.Description: It controls the charge mode of the backup battery.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: AGPS Online|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates whether to enable AGPS. AGPS helps increase the chances of getting GNSS position successfully and reduces the time needed to get GNSS position.

menu3.RangeMx: 00: Do not allow the cell information report.|40: Allow the cell information report after failing to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|80: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM after getting GNSS position successfully every time if cell information is available.|C0: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM no matter whether it is successful to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|&+RESP:GTRTL|+RESP:GTLBC|+RESP:GTFRI / +RESP:GTERI|+RESP:GTSOS|+RESP:GTTOW|
menu3.Description: A hexadecimal numeral to indicate how to report cell information.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: GPS|4: GPS and BeiDou|
menu3.Description: The working mode of GNSS chip.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It controls whether to invert the output state of OUTPUT1.

menu2.name: DOG (Protocol Watchdog)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOG command is used to reboot the device in a time based manner or upon ignition. This helps the device avoid working in an abnormal state for a long time. Besides these two automatic reboot methods, the device also supports the use of the digital input to trigger the reboot manually.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Reboot Periodically|2: Ignition Reboot|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the watchdog function.
The time at which the reboot operation is performed when <Interval> condition is met.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: ID of the digital input port which is used to trigger the manually reboot in despite of working mode.
The interval for rebooting the device when there is no network signal. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.
The interval for rebooting the device when the device is unable to be registered to the EGPRS/LTE network. 0 means “Do not reboot the device.”
The length of time (in minutes) before rebooting the device when the device fails to send a message. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.

menu2.name: GAM (GNSS-Assisted Motion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGAM is used for assisting in measuring motion with GNSS if the sensor detects stationary state while the vehicle is ignition on.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the GNSS-assisted motion measurement function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the use of GNSS speed to assist with motion status measurement based on motion sensor state.

menu2.name: HMC (Hour Meter Count)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHMC is used to measure the accumulated use time of the device with each actuation of ignition on. To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/Disable the hour meter count function. If the hour meter count function is enabled, the hour meter count will be increased when the device detects the vehicle ignition is turned on.

menu2.name: HRM (Hex Report Mask)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTHRM command is used to control the composition of the corresponding HEX report message. In each HEX report message, the corresponding mask for the report indicates which part is reported.

menu3.RangeMx: Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number

Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Analog Input Mode|Analog Input1 Voltage|Reserved|Reserved|Digital IO Status|Motion Status|Satellite Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Extend Mask Flag
CSQ RSSI / CSQ BER|

|Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Analog Input Mode|Analog Input1 Voltage|Reserved|Reserved|Digital IO Status|Motion Status|Satellite Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|

|Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number|INF Expansion Mask|+RESP:GTVER|+RESP:GTIOS|+RESP:GTGPS|+RESP:GTBAT|+RESP:GTCID|+RESP:GTCSQ|+RESP:GTTMZ|+RESP:GTGSM
|+RESP:GTGSV|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTSCS|Reserved|Reserved|INF Expansion2 Mask|
|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTBSV|Reserved|Network Type
|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|UID
|Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number

menu2.name: OWH (Outside Working Hours)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWH is used to define the working hours and the working mode to protect the privacy.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Manual Start Mode|2: Full Manual Mode|3: Automatic Mode|

menu2.name: PDS (Preserving Device's States)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPDS is used to preserve specified logic states for the device. The function works according to the <Mode> setting, and the logic state(s) to be saved are selected according to the value of <Mask>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Save Logical States|2: Reset Logical States|
menu3.Description: The working mode of preserving special logic state of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: State of GEO|1: Reserved|2: Reserved|3: Information of last known position|4: State of ignition|5: State of wave shape 1 and final state of gradual progressive wave shape|6: State of digital input|7: State of SPD|8: State of SSR|9: State of main power|10: State of PEO|

menu2.name: PIN (Auto-unlock PIN)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPIN is used to configure the auto-unlock PIN function of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Set it to 1 to enable the auto-unlock PIN function, and set it to 0 to disable this function.
The code used to unlock the SIM PIN.

menu2.name: TMA (Time Adjustment)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTMA is used to adjust for the local time of the device remotely. Upon receiving this command, the device will set the time zone and daylight saving accordingly. Then it will use the given UTC time to adjust for the local time based on the time zone and daylight saving setting.

menu3.Description: It indicates the positive or negative offset of the local time from UTC time.
UTC offset in hours.
UTC offset in minutes.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable daylight saving time.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to check GNSS UTC time with network time.

menu2.name: WLT (Allowlist)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWLT is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to perform the SMS functions.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0: White list for location by call.|Bit1: Reserved.|Bit2: White list for SMS.|
menu3.Description: It configures the working mode of this function. If a bit is set to 1, only the phone numbers in white list will be valid for the corresponding feature. If a bit is set to 0, the corresponding white list will be ignored.

A list of comma-separated phone numbers to be updated to the white list. The total number of the phone numbers is determined by <Start Index> and <End Index>. The format of the phone numbers includes area code and phone number. The area code is optional.

menu2.name: AVS (Accelerometer Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAVS is used to configure parameters for detecting virtual ignition status based on motion status. It works when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Accelerometer (motion status) virtual ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: A time parameter to determine whether the device enters stationary state. The device will be considered in stationary state after the motion sensor detects stationary state and the stationary state is maintained for the period of time specified by the parameter <Rest Validity>.

A time parameter to determine whether the device enters moving state. The device will be considered in moving state after the motion sensor detects movement and the moving state is maintained for the period of time specified by the parameter <Movement Validity>.

menu2.name: VVS (Voltage Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVVS is used to configure parameters for checking ignition state by voltage. It will work when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Voltage Virtual Ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: The external power voltage in ignition on state. Different vehicles have different voltage in ignition on state. This parameter should be set very close to the original external power so that the device can detect ignition event more accurately.
The offset from <Ignition On Voltage> used to determine ignition on or ignition off state.
The debounce time before updating virtual ignition on state according to the external power voltage. Unit: second.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable smart voltage adjustment algorithm.
The debounce time before updating the virtual ignition off state according to the external power voltage.

menu2.name: VMS (Virtual Ignition Mode Selection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVMS is used to configure the mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable |1: Motion status to simulate ignition status|2: Voltage virtual ignition detection mode. |4: Accelerometer virtual ignition detection mode|7: Combined detection mode. |
menu3.Description: A numeral to define the working mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to detect the ignition on event. The logic of each bit is controlled by the parameter <Virtual Ignition On Logic>.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to detect ignition off event. All bits matched are considered as ignition off event.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: AND logic.|1: OR logic.|
menu3.Description: The logic of each bit in <Virtual Ignition On Mask>.

If this parameter is set to 1, the device will generate VGN or VGF event based on external power voltage. When the external voltage meets the trigger condition defined in AT+GTVVS, VGN/VGF will be reported.
It controls whether hardware ignition and virtual ignition can work at the same time. This parameter works only after device reboot when the value changes.

menu2.name: CMD (Command String Storage)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMD command is used to store the commands which will be used by the command AT+GTUDF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete command.|1: Add command.|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the store command string.
A numeric to identify the stored command.
The whole content of the stored command.

menu2.name: UDF (User Defined Function)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUDF command is used to bind input events and stored commands. The input events will trigger the corresponding stored commands.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable The Event Group.|1: Enable The Event Group|2: Delete The Event Group|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the user defined fuction.
A numeric to identify the group of input events and stored commands to execute.

menu3.RangeMx: Power on finished|Ignition on|Ignition off|Attached to the GPRS network|Not attached to the GPRS network|Registered on GSM network|Not registered on GSM network|Network roaming|Network non-roaming|SIM card is locked|GNSS is on|GNSS is off|The device is stationary|The device is moving|External charge inserted|No external charge|The device is charging|The device is not charging|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input 1 is activated|Digital input 1 is inactivated|SIM card is inserted|SIM card is not inserted|Reserved|Reserved|Inside the speed range|Outside the speed range|Messages need to be sent|No messages need to be sent|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Network jamming is detected|Network jamming is not detected|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input6 is inactivated|Digital input6 is activated|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|The device fixes GNSS successfully|The device fails to fix GNSS|
menu3.Description: The bitwise mask to indicate the input events included in the group.
The debounce time for input events before the specified stored commands are executed.

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Geo 0|Inside the Geo 1|Inside the Geo 2|Inside the Geo 3|Inside the Geo 4|Inside the Geo 5|Inside the Geo 6|Inside the Geo 7|Inside the Geo 8|Inside the Geo 9|Inside the Geo 10|Inside the Geo 11|Inside the Geo 12|Inside the Geo 13|Inside the Geo 14|Inside the Geo 15|Inside the Geo 16|Inside the Geo 17|Inside the Geo 18|Inside the Geo 19|

Outside the Geo 0|Outside the Geo 1|Outside the Geo 2|Outside the Geo 3|Outside the Geo 4|Outside the Geo 5|Outside the Geo 6|Outside the Geo 7|Outside the Geo 8|Outside the Geo 9|Outside the Geo 10|Outside the Geo 11|Outside the Geo 12|Outside the Geo 13|Outside the Geo 14|Outside the Geo 15|Outside the Geo 16|Outside the Geo 17|Outside the Geo 18|Outside the Geo 19|

Stocmd ID Mask 0|Stocmd ID Mask 1|Stocmd ID Mask 2|Stocmd ID Mask 3|Stocmd ID Mask 4|Stocmd ID Mask 5|Stocmd ID Mask 6|Stocmd ID Mask 7|Stocmd ID Mask 8|Stocmd ID Mask 9|Stocmd ID Mask 10|Stocmd ID Mask 11|Stocmd ID Mask 12|Stocmd ID Mask 13|Stocmd ID Mask 14|Stocmd ID Mask 15|Stocmd ID Mask 16|Stocmd ID Mask 17|Stocmd ID Mask 18|Stocmd ID Mask 19|Stocmd ID Mask 20|Stocmd ID Mask 21|Stocmd ID Mask 22|Stocmd ID Mask 23|Stocmd ID Mask 24|Stocmd ID Mask 25|Stocmd ID Mask 26|Stocmd ID Mask 27|Stocmd ID Mask 28|Stocmd ID Mask 29|Stocmd ID Mask 30|Stocmd ID Mask 31|
menu3.Description: Note: The maximum number of the stored commands to be excuted in a group is five.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

Inside the Peo 0|Inside the Peo 1|Inside the Peo 2|Inside the Peo 3|Inside the Peo 4|Inside the Peo 5|Inside the Peo 6|Inside the Peo 7|Inside the Peo 8|Inside the Peo 9|Inside the Peo 10|Inside the Peo 11|Inside the Peo 12|Inside the Peo 13|Inside the Peo 14|Inside the Peo 15|Inside the Peo 16|Inside the Peo 17|Inside the Peo 18|Inside the Peo 19|

Outside the Peo 0|Outside the Peo 1|Outside the Peo 2|Outside the Peo 3|Outside the Peo 4|Outside the Peo 5|Outside the Peo 6|Outside the Peo 7|Outside the Peo 8|Outside the Peo 9|Outside the Peo 10|Outside the Peo 11|Outside the Peo 12|Outside the Peo 13|Outside the Peo 14|Outside the Peo 15|Outside the Peo 16|Outside the Peo 17|Outside the Peo 18|Outside the Peo 19|

menu2.name: ASC (Axis Self-Calibration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTASC is used to define the condition for calibrating the directions of accelerometer. When the condition is matched and the accelerometer calibration succeeds, the device will report event message +RESP:GTASC which includes the calibration result to backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the +RESP:GTASC report|1: Enable the +RESP:GTASC report|

menu2.name: FRI (Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFRI is used to configure the parameters for fixed report FRI or ERI.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Fixed Time Report.|2: Fixed Distance Report. |3: Fixed Mileage Report. |4: Optimum Report.|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report.|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the fixed report function.
Enable/disable report when there is no GNSS fix.
Enable/disable the time range specified by <Start Time> and <End Time>. If the time range is enabled, the position reporting will be limited within the time range.
The start time of the schedule fixed report.
The end time of the schedule fixed report.
The interval time to update GNSS position.
Timed cycle to send report to the backend server.
The amount of space between two places.\nThe specified distance if unit passed every time, it will send the position information.
Mileage is the total of distance.\nThe specified mileage if unit passed every time, it will send the position information.
A numeral indicating whether to report +RESP:GTFRI message based on change in the direction of device movement.

menu3.RangeMx: Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|RAT and Band Data|
menu3.Description: Used to configure whether to report the data from peripherals by +RESP:GTERI.

After the ignition is turned off, the +RESP:GTFRI/ +RESP:GTERI message will continue to be reported according to <Send Interval> for an extra period of time specified by <Continue Time>, and then will be reported according to <IGF Report Interval>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not wrap corner point|1: Wrap corner point and wait|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to wrap corner point together with other fixed GNSS points and wait until the condition to send +RESP:GTFRI reaches according to the value of <Mode>.

menu2.name: FFC (Frequency Change of FRI)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFFC is used to change the parameters of fixed report when a certain event occurs, so that different report interval requirements can be met. When the event disappears, the device will resume its previous settings.

menu3.Description: The priority of the event which triggers the change of fixed report parameters. 0 means “The highest priority”.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Change FRI parameters By Geo-Fence Alarm|2: Change FRI parameters By Know Roaming Alarm|3: Change FRI parameters By Unknow Roaming Alarm|
menu3.Description: It specifies the trigger event for the fixed report parameter change.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Fixed Distance Report|3: Fixed Mileage Report|4: Optimum Report|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report|
menu3.Description: If the specified event occurs, the working mode of the fixed report will be changed according to this parameter.
The interval for sending the position information when the ignition is on. Unit: second.
The specified distance for sending the position information when the mode is fixed distance report. Unit: meter.
The specified path length for sending the position information when the mode is fixed mileage report or optimum report. Unit: meter.
The interval for fixing and sending the position information when the ignition is off and <Power Saving Mode> in AT+GTCFG is set to 0 or 2. Unit: second.
The interval for GNSS fix. Unit: second.
A numeral indicating whether to report +RESP:GTFRI message based on change in the direction of device movement.

menu2.name: CRA (Crash Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCRA is used to configure the parameters for crash detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Detection Of Crash With Three-Axis|2: Enable Detection Of Crash With Self-calibration Three-Axis|3:This mode works mostly like Mode 2, and the difference is that in this mode <Fall Degrees> on the Z-axis is checked additionally.|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the crash detection function.
The acceleration threshold for crash in X direction.
The acceleration threshold for crash in Y direction.
The acceleration threshold for crash in Z direction.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Start Sampling After power on|1: Start Sampling After ignition on|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate when to start sampling acceleration data.
The number of recorded XYZ-axis acceleration samples before crash.
The number of XYZ-axis acceleration samples recorded after crash.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable the acceleration report.|1:Enable the acceleration report. The device will report 75 sets of tri-axial acceleration data to the backend server in the message +RESP:GTACC.|
0:Report the message +RESP:GTCRA.|1:Report the message +RESP:GTECR to include more information.|

menu2.name: GEO (Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGEO is used to configure the parameters of circular Geo-Fence. Circular Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated. .

menu3.Description: The ID of the circular Geo-Fence.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: The working mode for the device to report the Geo-Fence message GIN or GOT to the backend server.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the center of the Geo-Fence circular region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the center of the Geo-Fence circular region.
The radius of the Geo-Fence circular region.
The interval of GNSS checking for the Geo-Fence alarm.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|21: Auto Mode|22: Manual Mode|
menu3.Description: The Trigger mode of the Geo-Fence alarm.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Whether to report +RESP:GTGES message when the specified trigger mode is triggered and when the Geo-Fence is cancelled.
Start to monitor the device that enters the geo-fence or departs from the geo-fence.
End monitoring the device that enters the geo-fence or departs from the geo-fence.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Ignore State Change|1: Need State Change|
menu3.Description: The mode for reporting the device’s GEO state.

menu2.name: PEO (Polygon Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEO is used to configure the parameters of Polygon Geo-Fence. Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo-fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated.

menu3.Description: The ID of the polygon Geo-Fence.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: The working mode for the device to report the polygon Geo-Fence message to the backend server.
The start point of the polygon GEO-Fence of a set of points.
The end point of the polygon GEO-Fence of a set of points.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence region.
The interval of GNSS checking for the Geo-Fence alarm.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report when getting the PEO state for the first time.|1: Do not report until the PEO state changes.
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the mode of reporting PEO state.

menu2.name: HBM (Harsh Behavior Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHBM is used to monitor the harsh driving behavior based on GNSS or motion sensor.The same harsh behavior within 30 seconds will only be reported once if only GNSS is used to measure harsh driving behavior.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Detected by GNSS only|2: Detected by motion sensor only|3: Detected by motion sensor or GNSS|4: Detected by motion sensor and GNSS|5: Detected by XYZ-axis acceleration data only|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the harsh behavior monitoring function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Discard Unknow Alarm|1: Discard Unknow Alarm|

menu3.Description: If the last known speed of unit read from GNSS is greater or equal to<High Speed>, the vehicle that the terminal is attached to is considered to be high speed.
The threshold for harsh braking in high speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration in high speed level.
If the last known speed is less than 'High Speed' while greater or equal to <Medium Speed>, the vehicle is considered to be medium speed.
The threshold for harsh braking in medium speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration in medium speed level.
The threshold for harsh braking in low speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration in low speed level.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Only Report HBM Alarm.|1: Report HBE and HBM Alarm.|2: Only Report HBE Alarm.|

menu2.name: IDL (Excessive Idling Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDL is used to detect the engine excessive idling (vehicle stays stationary while ignition is on). To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device. If the vehicle is entering into/leaves the idle status, the device will report the event message IDN/IDF to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Working mode of excessive idling detection.
If the vehicle is detected to be stationary with ignition on for this time long, it is considered to be in idling status.
The time of the vehicle is considered to leave idling status.
If the vehicle moves a longer distance than <Debounce Distance> after it enters into idling status, the vehicle will be considered to leave idling status.

menu2.name: JBS (Jamming Behavior Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJBS is used for the Jamming Behavior.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Jamming Behavior Setting Configure Mode.|2: Jamming Behavior Setting Reset Mode.|
menu3.Description: The working mode.
It specifies the length of time the siren is on.
It specifies the length of time the siren is off.
It pointed to cut fuel length of time.
The speed limit to cut off fuel.
Set the initial state of output 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable motion sensor.|1: Enable motion sensor.|
menu3.Description: The GNSS fixed fail is timeout, whether need judge motion sensor state to cut fuel.
It pointed to GNSS timeout length of time.
If the device enters into JBS and then cuts off fuel, it will check the current jamming state when the Fuel Cut-off Timer T3 condition is met.
It indicates the length of time to be waited before releasing fuel and quitting JBS state machine.
It indicates the length of time the siren alarm sounds.
It indicates the length of time for preparing for alarm.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The output1 is used for 'cut off fuel'.|1: The output1 is used for 'siren' alarm.|

menu2.name: JDC (Jamming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJDC is used to configure the parameters for jamming detection. When the detection condition is matched, the device will report the event message JDR/JDS to the backend server according to the <Mode> setting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report the alarm message upon entering into jamming state.|2: Report the alarm message upon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the working mode of the Jamming Behavior Setting function.
The built-in LTE jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in LTE jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in 2G jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in 2G jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
When the device detects the jamming, the device based on this parameter to trigger the enter Jamming event.
When the device quits the jamming, the device based on this parameter to trigger the quit Jamming event.

menu2.name: RMD (Roaming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRMD is used to configure the parameters for roaming detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Working mode.
The index range of the white list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the white list to which code are to be updated.
The index range of the white list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the white list to which code are to be updated.
The index range of the list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the list to which code are to be updated.
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent in known roaming status.
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent in unknown roaming status.
Specify the ID of the output port to generate specified waveform after speed alarm is triggered.
Set the final status of the output port when the waveform remains high or low.
Set half-cycle time of square-wave.
The number of square-wave generated from output port.

menu2.name: SOS (SOS Setting)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure a specified input port for emergency. When an emergency occurs, the end user can use the specified input port to trigger the emergency call and report the position message SOS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: Send the current position to the backend server only|4:Send the current position to the SMS gateway via SMS|
menu3.Description: The working mode of SOS function.
ID of the digital input port which triggers the SOS function.
Specify the ID of the output port to generate specified waveform after SOS is initiate.
Set the final status of the output port when the waveform remains high or low.
Set half-cycle time of square-wave.
The number of square-wave generated from output port.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Send The Current GNSS Location|2: Send The Last GNSS Location|3: Both Mode 1 And 2|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the type of the GNSS position.

menu2.name: SPD (Speed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a speed range for the speed alarm function of the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal could report the message SPD to the backend server when its moving speed is outside or inside the range.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report speed alarm if the current speed is within the speed range |2: Report speed alarm if the current speed is outside the speed range|3: Report speed alarm only one time if the current speed is within/outside the speed range|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the speed alarm.
Minimum speed limit.
Maximum speed limit.
A period of time that the speed meets and maintains in the alarm condition.
The interval of sending speed alarm message if unit maintains in the alarm condition.
Specify the ID of the output port to generate specified waveform after speed alarm is triggered.
Set the final status of the output port when the waveform remains high or low.
Set half-cycle time of square-wave.
The number of square-wave generated from output port.

menu2.name: SSR (Start/Stop Report)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSSR is used to detect the status of vehicle (Start/Stop status). When it is detected by the device that the vehicle is entering into Start/Stop status, the device will report the event message STR/STP to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The working mode.
After the vehicle enters into start status, if it rest again and keeps in that status for this time long, the vehicle is considered to leave start status.
If the vehicle is detected to be moving with ignition on for this time long, it is considered to be in start status.
The start speed threshold to determine whether the vehicle is start or not.
After the vehicle enters into stop status and stay stop for this time long.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Minute|1: Second|
menu3.Description: It controls the time unit of <Time to Stop> and <Time to Start> parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:The event message +RESP:GTSTP will be reported when the engine is turned off and the time meets the parameter <Time to Stop>.|1:The event message +RESP:GTSTP will be reported immediately when the engine is turned off, it only works when <Mode> is set to 1.|
menu3.Description: Whether to report STP message immediately when the engine is turned off.

menu2.name: Tow (Tow Alarm)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTOW command is used to configure the tow alarm parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: A duration threshold to judge whether the moving terminal is considered being towed after its engine off.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit with engine off is in fake tow after it changes to move from stillness.
Reporting interval for sending tow alarm message.
The ID of the output port which generates the specified waveform when tow event is detected.
Set the final status of the output port when the waveform remains high or low.
Set half-cycle time of square-wave.
The number of square-wave generated from the specified output port.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit enters stillness status.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit enters motion status.
The threshold for on-board motion sensor to judge whether unit is moving.
A distance parameter to determine whether the device is considered to be towed after the engine is turned off.

menu2.name: ACJ (Anti-Carjacking)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTACJ is used for the anti-carjacking function

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Anti-Carjacking Release Command|1:Anti-Carjacking Configure Command |2: Anti-Carjacking Query Command|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the AT+GTACJ command, set it to 1 for configuration command mode.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not trigger the anti-carjacking checking|1:Ignition mode|2: Combine ignition mode and door mode together|3:Ignition mode Auto Release Carjacking|
menu3.Description: The mode to trigger the anti-carjacking checking.
The ID of the digital input to connect the hijack button.
Timer for the hijack button pressing.
The ID of the digital input for detecting the status of the door.
The timer for carjacking checking.
The trigger timer for the valet service.
The time interval of the carjacking LED’s slow flashing.
The time interval of the carjacking LED’s fast flashing.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not use digital output 1|1: Use output to control the block|2: Use output to control LED/ Siren|
menu3.Description: The working mode to control the digital output 1 in the carjacking.
It configures the final status of the output port when triggered carjacking.
Set half-cycle time of square-wave.
The number of square-wave generated from output port.

menu2.name: AIS (Analog Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAIS is used to configure the parameters of analog input ports.

menu3.Description: The analog input port ID.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Alarm enters The Range|2: Enable Alarm exits The Range|
menu3.Description: Working mode of the analog input alarm.
The lower limit to the voltage of the analog input port to trigger the alarm.
The upper limit to the voltage of the analog input port to trigger the alarm.
The sampling period of the analog input port.
Specify the ID of the output port to output specified wave shape when the analog input alarm is triggered. If set to 0, no output wave.
Set the final status of the output port when the waveform remains high or low.
Set half-cycle time of square-wave.
The number of square-wave generated from output port.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: This parameter will use with <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters together,it express that the voltage margin error of the <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters, if the current value of voltage detection include in the voltage margin error of the min and max threshold, this voltage value will not be processed.

menu2.name: DIS (Digital Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDIS is used to configure the parameters of 2 digital input ports. The input <Ignition Detection> is dedicated to ignition detection. The other one inputis customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of the three digital input ports, the device will report the message DIS to the backend server.

menu3.Description: The ID of the ignition detection port.
The time for debouncing.
The digital input port ID.
The time for debouncing.
The validity time of the input port. 0 means “Do not check the validity time”.

menu2.name: DOS (Digital Output Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOS command is used to output specified wave shape from the digital output ports. A total of four wave shapes are supported as shown below. If set to wave shape 1, the device will maintain this wave shape at the specified output port after power reset.

menu3.Description: A numerical to indicate the version of this command.
The number of output ports which are going to be set.
A numerical to indicate the ID of output ports.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable status.|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-high-wave-shape Enable status|3:Gradual-progressive-low-wave-shape Enable status.|
menu3.Description: Valid only for the wave shape 1 as shown in Figure 2 and used to set the final status of the output port.
Please refer to Figure 2, Figure 3, Figure 4 and Figure 5. Unit: 100ms.
Please refer to Figure 2, Figure 3, Figure 4 and Figure 5.

menu3.RangeMx: For output 1 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|
menu3.Description: Whether or not to report +RESP:GTDOS when the status of wave shape 1 output changes.
Digital output will not be triggered when GNSS speed is over the set speed. The unit is km/h. 0 means “Disable this parameter”.
If the speed is lower than <Overspeed Restrict Output> for the length of time specified by <Debounce Time>, AT+GTDOS will be executed.

menu2.name: EPS (External Power Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEPS is used to configure the parameters for external power supply monitoring. The device will measure and monitor the voltage of the external power supply. If the voltage of the external power supply meets the predefined alarm condition, the device will report an alarm message EPS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable |1: Report when the input voltage within the range|2: Report when the input voltage outside the range|
menu3.Description: Working mode of the external power supply monitoring.
The lower limit to the voltage of the external power supply to trigger the alarm.
The upper limit to the voltage of the external power supply to trigger the alarm.
The sampling period to measure the external power supply.
The time for debouncing to avoid exceptional voltage drop of the external power supply.
Specify the ID of the output port to output specified wave shape when the +RESP:GTEPS alarm is triggered.
Set the final status of the output port when the waveform remains high or low.
Set half-cycle time of square-wave.
The number of square-wave generated from output port.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not report external power supply voltage|1: Report external power supply voltage|

menu3.Description: This parameter will use with <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters together, it express that the voltage margin error of the <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters, if the current value of voltage detection include in the voltage margin error of the min and max threshold, this voltage value will not be processed.

This parameter will be used with <Debounce Time> together, if the voltage drops or bursts exceptionally greater than <Debounce Voltage Threshold>, the device will start to debounce voltage by <Debounce Time>.
The validity time of detecting the device connecting or disconnecting main power supply, 0 means not to check the validity time.

menu2.name: GDO (Gradual Digital Output)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTGDO command is used to configure specified gradual progressive wave shape from the digital output ports.

menu3.Description: Time (in units of 100ms) that the output will be in active state, during the first cycle.
Time (in units of 100ms) that forms a complete cycle (ON phase time + OFF phase time).
Time (in units of 100ms) that shall be added to the ON phase time, before starting the next cycle. If this time is 0, the cycles are kept equal.

menu2.name: IOB (Input/Output Binding)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure the user defined output-port actions triggered by input ports. If the I/O binding is configured and the corresponding condition is met, the device will output specified wave shape on the specified output port.

menu3.Description: The IO binding ID for user to define.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input 6|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask for the combination of input ports.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input 6|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask for the combination of trigger conditions from combined input ports.
The sample period to check status of all combined digital input ports within one IO binding.
Specify the ID of the output port to generate specified waveform after trigger conditions meet.
Set the final status of the output port when the waveform remains high or low.
Set half-cycle time of square-wave.
The number of square-wave generated from output port.

menu2.name: IGM (Ignition Multiplexing Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIGM is used to make the ignition input available as a digital input. If the logic status of the digital input port changes, the device will report the message +RESP:GTDIS to the backend server.

menu3.Description: The ID of the digital input that the ignition input is configured as.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the +RESP:GTDIS report.|1: Activate the digital input.|2: Deactivate the digital input.|3: Both upon activating and deactivating the digital input.|
menu3.Description: It defines the event(s) to trigger the +RESP:GTDIS report to the backend server.
The debounce time for interruptible input port.
The validity time of the input port. 0 means “Do not check the validity time”.

menu2.name: FVR (Configuration File Version Record)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFVR is used to record information of the configuration file generated by Manage Tool for AT+GTUPC.

menu3.Description: The name of the configuration file.
The version number of the configuration file.
The parameter is used to confirm the validity of subsequent commands.
The time when the configuration file is generated.

menu2.name: UPC (Update Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUPC command is used to download configuration file over the air for the update of the local configuration.

menu3.Description: It specifies the maximum number of retries to download the configuration file upon download failure.
It specifies the expiration timeout of a single download.
The protocol used to download the file. Only HTTP is supported now.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable.|

menu3.Description: The time interval measured in hours for updating the configuration over the air.
It specifies the URL to download the configuration file.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates the working mode of downloading configuration over the air.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:UPC|1:EUC |
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the message to be reported for the configuration update status when <Enable Report> is 1.
A numeral to identify the configuration update request.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition Off|Ignition On|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the status in which the device can update the configuration.

menu2.name: UPD(Firmware Update)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUPD is used to start and stop the firmware update remotely.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Start the Firmware Update|1:Stop the Firmware Update|
0: HTTP.|
0: BB firmware update.
0:Report the +RESP:GTUPD message to indicate the firmware update status.|1:Report the +RESP:GTEUD message to indicate the firmware update status.|

menu2.name: RTO (Real Time Operation)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTO is used to retrieve information from the terminal or control the terminal when it executes certain actions.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS|1:RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP: GTRTL|2:READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM|3:REBOOT. Reboot the terminal|4:RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings|5:PWROFF. Power off the device|6:CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID|7:CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ|8:VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER|9:BAT. Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT|A:IOS. Get status of all the IO ports via the message +RESP:GTIOS|B: TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ|C:GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM|D: AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF|E: GSV/BSV. Request the device to report the GNSS satellites information via the message +RESP:GTGSV or +RESP:GTBSV|1C:ATI. Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI|25:SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status|31:DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports|
menu3.Description: It is used to retrieve information from unit or control the unit to execute certain actions.

menu3.groupname: 0 - GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 1 - RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP:GTRTL

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 2 - READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM
menu3.Description: To get AT command configuration.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Do not add cutoff characters to the message +RESP:GTALM.|1:Add cutoff characters to the message +RESP:GTALM.|

menu3.groupname: 4 - RESET. Reset all parameters to factory setting
menu3.Description: To reset AT command configuration.

menu3.groupname: 6 -CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 7 - CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 8 - VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 9 - BAT. Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: A - IOS. Get status of all the IO ports via the message +RESP:GTIOS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: B - TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: C - GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: D - AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: E - GSV/BSV. Request the device to report the GNSS satellites information via the message +RESP:GTGSV or +RESP:GTBSV
menu3.Description: If this field is reserved, the device will report +RESP:GTGSV/ +RESP:GTBSV.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 1C - ATI. Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI.
menu3.RangeMx: Firmware Version|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved for MCU|Reserved for MCU|Hardware Version|Reserved for HW|Reserved for HW|Reserved for HW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Sensor ID|Modem IMEI|
menu3.Description: If <Sub Command> is set to 1C, the basic information will be reported via the message +RESP:GTATI according to chosen <ATI Mask>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 25 - SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status
menu3.RangeMx: 0: Read self-calibration status.|1: Clear self-calibration status.|
menu3.Description: If <Sub Command> is set to 25, Read or Clear action is controlled by this parameter.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 31- DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports.

menu2.name: RTP (Remote File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTP is used to obtain files from the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Download File|
0: HTTP|
0: CA certificate.|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|

menu2.name: LTP (Local File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTLTP is used to write the file to the device by subcontracting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete File|1:Import File|
0: CA certificate|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|
